channel.title: New Version of SCAR coming out Soon
channel.description:
[Quote=Debug Box] 19.01.2007
Believe it or not but there is a new SCAR version almost ready. You will be informed here when it's released. [/Quote]
Its official. The Next Version of SCAR will be coming out soon
Discuss.
(Check the SRL boards for the official announcement: http://www.srl-forums.com/forum/scar-divi-3-t5996.html)

item.source: New Version of SCAR coming out Soon

item.title: New Version of SCAR coming out Soon
item.dc:creator: @WT-Fakawi WT-Fakawi
item.description:
@WT-Fakawi wrote:

From my point of view a great number of improvements have been made over SCAR 2.03. I will tell you what I know. I will basically repeat Freddy1990’s post.

[center][size=14pt]Divi.[/size][/center]

  1. Tabbed Browsing.

Edit by Bebe: Sorry Fakawi, but freddy doesn’t want any pictures released, unless you have his permission. (Then just tell me :o)

You can now split up large project into smaller chunks. Thats a huge improvement. No more scrolling through 2000+ lines.

  1. Variable DTM’s.

This is maybe from a rs point-of-view the best improvement. It basically means this: You make a DTM the usual way, and then from inside your script you can assign it custom colors! It will now be very easy to spot mainscreen objects, minimap roadsections, rockformations and treeclusters, to name just a few.

  1. Compass.

Since the compass had undergone a facelift, the old compassroutines were rendered useless. Well, not anymore!

  1. Forms.

I am not much of a interface man, but this update adds functionality to the standard Windows Interface as well as for dynamic data inside windows, not unlike Scar’s debug and status Windowdefs.

  1. ColorPicker.

This one you will need to see with your own eyes. Wont reveal, but it is very very…

  1. ColorComparison.

Cant tell, havent played with it, but it involves some AFAIK highlight comparisons and some smart autocolor detection.

  1. Misc.

New Math functionality is implemented. This will speed up a all math oriented processes. New Mouse routines, Code Hints disable, better Downloads, more hotkeys, and lots and lots and lots more…! And yes, it is backwards compatible.

[CENTER]—

-= WT-Fakawi acknowledgement =-[/CENTER]

I want to thank Kaitnieks for putting his trust into Freddy1990 and helping out in creating this. We owe you all! But most credits goes to Freddy1990 for all the hard work, persistence and countless hours he has worked to come this far. Your a Hero!

[CENTER]—

Scar can finally die peacefully. Long live Divi![/CENTER]

Read full topic
item.source: New Version of SCAR coming out Soon

item.title: New Version of SCAR coming out Soon
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Ace:

Tabbed browsing only means that you’ll be able to have two (or more) scripts open simultaneously. Not that you’ll be able to macro with multiple scripts on two or more clients.

You just have to use silent clicking with a window focus hack.
But it’ll likely be buggy and/or specific to just a couple versions of Windows. So… it might be suiting to release it in a separate version, in some ways. Or just make it so that it can be done from a plugin, but that’s need some special stuff… (for instance, you’d have get control over SCAR’s drawing events in the plugin… [so that you don’t have to api hook BitBlt, lol])
But leave that to the future. My current unfinished projects are on high priority. Since no one has yet to see them really. -_-

Read full topic
